body.p:
Mount Sterling Ky Oct 13th 1865
Govenor Thos E Bramblett
Frankfort Ky
My Dear Sir

Mr James Warren of the County of Bath this day called upon me in regard to his Son -- Some time since -- from 6 to 12 months ago -- a man named Davis was found murdered & Robbed -- Wilkins Warren was accused of the Deed -- having left the county about that time -- Upon the Repersentation of some parties from Bath Co Your Excellency put out a Reward of $300 for the apprehension of Wilkins Warren -- The facts of the case are these -- Wilkins Warren -- had left the County of Bath 5 days before this man Davis, was found & Davis from the proof had not been dead 2 days -- Warren was always a most thurgh Union man, & that section of Bath almost unanimosly Rebel, & they charged this upon Warren to prevent him returning -- he having left his home because of the war troubles & hence this Reward -- Warren now wants to return & surrender himself up to the Law & have the charge investigated -- but neither he nor his Father also a thorough Union man & perfect gentleman, want these Rebels to be gratified by having him apprehended under this Reward -- It is a matter of pride with them & I thank God, they have this pride, for I know them well & know also the people, Rebels, by
whom they are surrendered -- the men their neighbors in are some of the worse -- not that in which the Savior it -- are apprehending his return & have their watches out, not only for the purpose of receiving the Reward of $300 but that they may boast one having caught him -- I am in possession of all the facts in this case -- am satisfied that Wilkins Warren is innocent --

I writ to ask you to withdraw this offer of Reward by a Public Proclamation & I will guaranty that Wilkins Warren return as soon as he can be delivered of the same & render himself up to the Law -- He is now on a trip across the plains with a wagon Train -- but I can reach him & he will return -- Please answer & let me know what step you will take in the case
